title: The Wall Street Journal: Theranos, founder Elizabeth Holmes charged with fraud by SEC
text:
Theranos Inc. founder and chief executive Elizabeth Holmes surrendered voting control of her blood-testing company, paid a $500,000 penalty and agreed to a 10-year ban from being an officer or director in a public company in settling civil-fraud charges Wednesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
The settlement follows a more than two-year investigation by the SEC prompted by revelations in The Wall Street Journal. In October 2015, the Journal published an article revealing that Theranos used its proprietary blood-testing... RELATED VIDEO Theranos CEO: Company Did Not Rush to Market Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes disagrees with the assertion that her company was too quick to market its products. She speaks at the WSJDLive 2015 conference in Laguna Beach, Calif. (Originally published Oct. 21, 2015)
